OptionChoice.name: enableBewitchment
OptionChoice.Description: Should Custom Ore Generation handle Bewitchment ore generation?

Choice.description: Use Custom Ore Generation to handle Bewitchment ores.
Bewitchment ores will be handled by Minecraft directly.

OptionChoice.name: cleanUpBewitchment
OptionChoice.Description: Should Custom Ore Generation use the Substitution Pass to remove all instances of Bewitchment ore from the world? If the mod's oregen can be turned off in its configuration, then it's recommended to do so, as the substitution pass can slow the game significantly. If this option is disabled without disabling the mod's own ore generation, you'll end up with two oregens working at once, flooding the world with ore. Enabled by default to ensure the ores are completely removed.

Choice.description: Use the substitution pass to clean up Bewitchment ores.
Bewitchment ores do not need to be cleaned up by a substitution pass.

Choice.Description: Wide, thin, and flat disks of ore.
Large veins filled very lightly with ore.
Large irregular clouds filled lightly with ore.

Choice.description: Salt is not generated in the world.

OptionNumeric.name: wtchSaltFreq
OptionNumeric.Description: Frequency multiplier for Bewitchment Salt distributions

OptionNumeric.name: wtchSaltSize
OptionNumeric.Description: Size multiplier for Bewitchment Salt distributions

Choice.Description: Small, fairly rare motherlodes with 2-4 horizontal veins each.
Large irregular clouds filled lightly with ore.

Choice.description: Silver is not generated in the world.

OptionNumeric.name: wtchSilverFreq
OptionNumeric.Description: Frequency multiplier for Bewitchment Silver distributions

OptionNumeric.name: wtchSilverSize
OptionNumeric.Description: Size multiplier for Bewitchment Silver distributions

Choice.Description: Short and sparsely filled compound veins containing one material inside another.
Large irregular clouds filled lightly with ore.

Choice.description: Amethyst is not generated in the world.

OptionNumeric.name: wtchAmethystFreq
OptionNumeric.Description: Frequency multiplier for Bewitchment Amethyst distributions

OptionNumeric.name: wtchAmethystSize
OptionNumeric.Description: Size multiplier for Bewitchment Amethyst distributions

Choice.Description: Short and sparsely filled compound veins containing one material inside another.
Large irregular clouds filled lightly with ore.

OptionNumeric.Description: Size multiplier for Bewitchment Opal distributions

Choice.Description: Short and sparsely filled compound veins containing one material inside another.
Large irregular clouds filled lightly with ore.

Choice.description: Garnet is not generated in the world.

OptionNumeric.Description: Frequency multiplier for Bewitchment Garnet distributions

OptionNumeric.name: wtchGarnetSize

Substitute.name: wtchOverworldBlockSubstitute0
Substitute.Comment: The global option deferredPopulationRange must be large enough to catch all ore clusters (>= 32).

Cloud.name: wtchSaltCloud
Cloud.Description: Wide, thin, and flat disks of ore. Primarily, this distribution is meant to provide realistic distribution of stone in a strata formation.

Veins.name: wtchSaltVeins
Veins.Description: Large veins filled very lightly with ore. Because they contain less ore per volume, these veins are relatively wide and long. Mining the ore from them is time consuming compared to solid ore veins. They are also more difficult to follow, since it is harder to get an idea of their direction while mining.

Cloud.name: wtchSaltCloud
Cloud.Description: Large irregular clouds filled lightly with ore. These are huge, spanning several adjacent chunks, and consequently rather rare. They contain a sizeable amount of ore, but it takes some time and effort to mine due to low density. The intent for strategic clouds is that the player will need to actively search for one and then set up a semi- permanent mining base and spend some time actually mining the ore.

Veins.name: wtchSaltHintVeins
Veins.Description: Single blocks, generously scattered through all heights (density is about that of vanilla iron ore). They will replace dirt and sandstone (but not grass or sand), so they can be found nearer to the surface than most ores. Intened to be used as a child distribution for large, rare strategic deposits that would otherwise be very difficult to find. Note that the frequency is multiplied by ground level to maintain a constant density, but not by ore frequency because it is assumed that the frequency of the parent distribution will already be scaled by that.

StandardGen.name: wtchSaltStandard
StandardGen.Description: A master preset for standardgen ore distributions.

Veins.name: wtchSilverVeins
Veins.Description: Small, fairly rare motherlodes with 2-4 horizontal veins each.

Veins.name: wtchAmethystVeins
Veins.Description: Short sparsely filled veins sloping up from near the bottom of the map.
